--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "bungotakadasword" 
<MuramasaIII@a...> wrote:
> --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@E...> 
> wrote:
> 
> > A piece that has been cleaned to the point that it looks younger 
> than it should can be a problem.  This is where cleaning out the 
> sukashi openings can hurt you even if you personally like the way 
> that looks.  If the age cues are contradictory, the judgment tends 
to 
> go to the younger date.  The object of conservation or even 
> restoration is not to make the guard look new.
> 
> 


one more question..........
what if there are active red rust in the opening ? leave it alone to 
continue doing structural damage ?  Some of the early sukashi guards 
have very " thin " opening and I have seen some iron  can literally 
fell off with the slightest touch............

milt
